params._owner: The account owner of the iTokens.
params._spender: The account allowed to send the iTokens.

allowance(address,address).return: The number of iTokens an account is allowing the spender  to send on its behalf.

params._spender: The account address that will be able to spend the tokens.
params._value: The amount of tokens allowed to spend.

params._owner: The account owner of the iTokens.

balanceOf(address).return: The number of iTokens an account owns.

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

totalSupply().return: The total number of iTokens in existence as of now.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

allowance(address,address).notice: Get the amount of iTokens allowed to be spent by a  given account on behalf of the owner.

approve(address,uint256).notice: Set an amount as the allowance of `spender` over the caller's tokens.     * Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.     * IMPORTANT: Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the desired value afterwards: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729     * Emits an {Approval} event.

balanceOf(address).notice: Get the amount of iTokens owned by an account.

totalSupply().notice: Get the total supply of iTokens.

nodes.documentation:
@notice Set an amount as the allowance of `spender` over the caller's tokens.
     * Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
     * IMPORTANT: Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk
that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate
transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race
condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the
desired value afterwards:
https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729
     * Emits an {Approval} event.
     * @param _spender The account address that will be able to spend the tokens.
@param _value The amount of tokens allowed to spend.
nodes.name: approve
_mint
_burn

nodes.documentation:
@title Advanced Token contract.
@notice This contract code comes from bZx. bZx is a protocol for tokenized margin
trading and lending https://bzx.network similar to the dYdX protocol.
 * AdvancedToken implements standard ERC-20 approval, mint and burn token functionality.
Logic (AdvancedToken) is kept aside from storage (AdvancedTokenStorage).
 * For example, LoanTokenLogicDai contract uses AdvancedToken::_mint() to mint
its Loan Dai iTokens.
nodes.name: AdvancedToken
